name: Landmine Press
how_to_perform:
1. Set up a landmine with the barbell in a socket or a sturdy base, such that it can rotate freely.
2. Hold a handle attached to the end of the bar with both hands, with your arms extended overhead and your hands shoulder-width apart.
3. Lower the bar down towards your chest by rotating your shoulders and extending your arms slightly, keeping your elbows straight.
4. Press the bar forward, extending your arms fully and rotating your shoulders back.
5. Focus on using your deltoids to press the weight upwards, squeezing your upper body for a brief moment at the top of the movement.
6. Slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position, repeating for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Landmine press is an upper-body exercise that targets the shoulders and surrounding muscles, performed with a rotating barbell handle
